intro: Driessenia ferox, commonly known as the Brazilian snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Driessenia ferox is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
